7224930AD0D04A5B914FC09473D6C720.description: Begin to explain variations in communication, including register.

E5FF1CEC53834A9D921CF42B107B4DE7.description: Evaluate own and others' talk, including what went well and what could be improved next time.

C66A3D6D976F42A59D96FFC932562415.description: Begin to make choices about the most appropriate media for a particular presentation.

8F0A452F80704F22B7883E9215C3D1E8.description: Plan and deliver independent and group presentations confidently to a range of audiences, adapting presentations appropriately to the audience.

6F410FDBD6C64972AF90180E37220602.description: Convey ideas about characters in drama in different roles and scenarios through deliberate choice of speech, gesture and movement.

B7982EDC49EA4869AED1114CA3987D65.description: Read aloud with accuracy, and increasing confidence and style.

B38556CB9CBF43DE805B4F5760FFAAD0.description: Encourage others to take turns in a discussion.

88A402A9608C415BBCCE5B5283A45FC8.description: Extend a discussion by building on own and other's ideas.

0E3A400B730F49588E16C78E8A33DFE9.description: Show consideration of another point of view.

B98B241F47E949EFA74C3D00C862BFDC.description: Take different assigned roles within groups, and begin to assign roles within a group.

77D68489B4EA4CD1861743A6CC48D442.description: Listen, reflect on what is heard and give a reasoned response with reference to at least one specific point made by the speaker.

A19327C51A684625AA34B7BD3B374259.description: Show awareness of different audiences, e.g. by using the appropriate register.

19763449C2384B9EBE80E3D100797FE8.description: Adapt non-verbal communication techniques for different purposes and contexts.

DB2F68BA60C94306893D782FE1DB798C.description: Use language to convey ideas and opinions, with increasing clarity and detail.

E76A6FB860314B69805EFE38C55CC343.description: Structure information to aid the listener’s understanding of the main and subsidiary points.

A8408C57B059418DB751E9945EAB658D.description: Adapt pace and tone of speech appropriately in formal and informal contexts.

55E2348BB28A421D8D56B28A2C4B5FC6.description: Proofread for grammar, spelling and punctuation errors, and make corrections, including using on-screen tools.

3E76C9B8EED4449A81079BB71C84EC4F.description: Evaluate own and others’ writing, suggesting improvements for sense, accuracy and content, including to enhance the effect.

E360C8B619CD452A911D531B8540122D.description: Begin to choose appropriate ways to lay out and present texts to suit the purpose and audience (handwritten, printed and onscreen).

69D65BBCAEC641BEAF73AE3E5C660B2A.description: Begin to decide when it is helpful to take notes and how to record them.

BC76F7F06F234B4EABD37FD0A595EEA5.description: Develop a personal handwriting style to write legibly, fluently and with appropriate speed.

7194A46D419541739ACDFFE8DCF62BF8.description: Write balanced arguments, developing points logically and convincingly.

1B634DCEDDF64415A3BB6B98176FD9CE.description: Develop writing of a range of text types for a specified audience, using appropriate content and language.

09811860DC1142E59FEF2DF7F0A811CA.description: Develop writing for a purpose using language and features appropriate for a range of text types.

1068A1E2056E440BA7CBE5CA8A771ADE.description: Write a playscript using production notes, language and stage directions, to develop characters and settings.

AEA3E6AC01AB4B52AB08A2ECEFF52AF0.description: Include different viewpoints in fiction, e.g. when writing stories with flashbacks.

8961986185B74B95B2D77FEE4DD95BAD.description: When writing stories, develop descriptions of settings, characters and action that engage and entertain the reader.

964D6AE07E4E46D58AFB86CB8D5812AD.description: Use effective planning to inform the content and structure of extended writing, e.g. chapters.

9D89EB3A1C66460F8A55FD3BA28AE930.description: Develop creative writing in a range of different genres of fiction and types of poems.

B27DACB625B9416CBE3A4A6F46BD92DC.description: Use organisational features appropriate to the text type, e.g. bulleted and numbered lists.

37D480E003CA47C697722453998FFA1E.description: Use a range of connectives to link paragraphs and sections clearly and cohesively, e.g. use of however and on the other hand to introduce counter-arguments in a balanced argument.

B29FE400CE494DC28F7C4A1BFB89CE7E.description: Use paragraphs, sections and chapters to organise ideas and support overall cohesion of a text, e.g. new chapters to manage flashbacks or events which are presented out of chronological sequence.

D584D10363FE4F6EBB683DE6B0523C5A.description: Manage the development of an idea across an extended piece of writing, e.g. by linking the end to the beginning.

C39633059BB743C3A63F862FB97DA45D.description: Use the conventions of standard English appropriately in writing, including for different types of texts, e.g. verb forms, sentence structure, use of different word classes.

B452B1EA23834A48A591808372401B03.description: Use relative pronouns to introduce additional detail.

7CDC3DC0B60B4155A65E358191128C7E.description: Ensure grammatical agreement of quantifiers with countable and uncountable nouns, e.g. less and fewer.

B3842B30D97B4461A88BD7B273A394D5.description: Use active and passive verb forms within sentences.

C5B39A7B2DF04A2186D5CF7BA02C3417.description: Use a variety of simple, compound and complex sentences chosen for effect.

060F53BD8B554631A7A319E98BA916EB.description: Use punctuation effectively to clarify meaning in complex sentences.

564835EE0801478D9F8F54EBCE30CC97.description: Punctuate direct and reported speech accurately.

641D88627BD642BA93C7C501C3D37D57.description: Use commas, dashes and brackets parenthetically.

6F21C156DA384CE0B9133BA21A581C9F.description: Use own lists of interesting and significant words, dictionaries and thesauruses to extend the range of vocabulary used in written work.

7E3E9A3DE227424B89D73A14D8BD3009.description: Begin to use figurative language to evoke an imaginative response from the reader.

00957983BEFB448C8033343445CB3D88.description: Choose and use vocabulary carefully to develop imaginative detail.

4136DAA675374415BD554848323C4C5F.description: Transform meaning with prefixes and suffixes.

07DF987C183A4DC9BDCB7EDF18B1902D.description: Explore and use words and phrases to convey shades of meaning appropriate to the context.

6B6B0778EB0841CBA1CDC0A75BA2C8FF.description: Use specialised vocabulary accurately to match a familiar topic.

C413F0467FCF4297A1E7E7E50E99CD2B.description: Use paper-based and on-screen tools to find the correct spelling of words; keep and use spelling logs of misspelt words, and identify words that need to be learned.

DED60DA84A4743FA98D0C6ABBCF81460.description: Use effective strategies to spell a wide range of words correctly.

A82A5B8478FA4213ACEBB2F8365BF098.description: Explore a range of spelling rules and exceptions.

41B24260C2174AC48FD315B033E8D36D.description: Spell familiar homophones and commonly confused words correctly, e.g. aloud, allowed; past, passed; advice, advise; desert, dessert.

3F18C17C8498422AB094603538726023.description: Further develop understanding of how to add prefixes and suffixes to root words, and when the root word changes.

238B0E6DE8764AFF995239233D07E86B.description: Explore and spell words with different suffixes but similar pronunciation, e.g. -tion, -cian, -sion, -ssion; -ance, -ence.

392CE60783FE465E9310263CA3282EA9.description: Explore and use different ways of representing consonants, e.g. -ck, -k, -ke, -que or -ch for /k/; -ch or -tch for /ʧ/; j-, g- or -dge for /ʤ/.

178825E749474143B745500B0998684D.description: Comment on how readers might react differently to the same text, depending on where or when they are reading it.

2F927821C29E4C73BE58B84A412C92D4.description: Begin to choose a more diverse range of books to read, including writers or genres which compare or contrast with previous reading.

1F260258506444AF833029D9C7DE5289.description: Express personal responses to texts, including preferences in terms of language, style and themes.

2D19C0D1C86748D8A539A21B232E8B6A.description: Enjoy independent and shared reading of fiction genres, poems, playscripts and non-fiction texts.

C1C5DDDDBA56433EBFA07540D0036E4D.description: Distinguish between texts with a writer's voice and texts with a narrator's voice.

D181BB745116407BAC796ECA2E905064.description: Comment on how different viewpoints are expressed in fiction and non-fiction texts.

F244F0BDE0154928B8EC8F0FB235F69C.description: Recognise explicit and implicit ways in which the theme of a text is conveyed.

FFBA26DD718847198120D00C091C60DB.description: Support answers to questions with reference to, or quotations from, one or more points in a text.

BF7D9EE2557B4D1193188910B464E01B.description: Locate and use relevant information from one or more points in a text, or from different texts, confidently and efficiently.

AD78D3551EE54702A8108E1AF47C08D2.description: Distinguish between fact and opinion in a range of texts.

D41A6404720C450E83387452D3F9B298.description: Comment on how a writer influences the reaction of readers, including how they present characters and settings, and evoke particular moods (e.g. suspense, anger, excitement).

0A14BC842A884D27A6D59B1F8C4B61AF.description: Make a range of plausible inferences from texts.

DA7F2B44DC5B4715A39205437E2A1747.description: Use evidence from more than one point in a story to support predictions about what might happen later in the story.

6976836D6498431BBE9E83B2306632D5.description: Explore implicit meanings in a range of texts.

2A21D5B25F624B2D9378C7DA21E03295.description: Summarise explicit meanings drawn from more than one point in a text.

5F87D0FD23B24162838C647C5C065E8C.description: Explore explicit meanings in a range of texts.

B7FDFB3422F741298D593AE97BC9A22B.description: Identify, discuss and compare the purposes and features of different non-fiction text types, including balanced written arguments.

DA2F223DD2CE462F9E27ED1BBC01956A.description: Read and explore a range of non-fiction text types.

97E4817F2B224EC386149A8EF6FD1481.description: Identify, discuss and compare different fiction genres and their typical characteristics.

0CC857321FF34A77A441E31F6E567F3C.description: Read and explore a range of fiction genres, poems and playscripts, including identifying the contribution of any visual elements or multimedia.

DF7CCB5BF1DE4939B06032CAE6CCF8B6.description: Understand the difference between fiction and non-fiction texts and locate books by classification.

4D73512204FB4425A6846780F69580B0.description: Explore and recognise how ideas are organised and linked cohesively across a text, e.g. new chapters to manage flashbacks or events which are presented out of chronological order; use of however and on the other hand to introduce a new paragraph in a balanced argument.

D569F095F8DE42A4B4A35B268EAD2650.description: Explore and recognise the key features of text structure in a range of different fiction and non-fiction texts, including poems and playscripts.

D82721FA61DF44A5A16670EE2620683C.description: Explore and describe the progression of ideas in a text, including the handling of time (e.g. to manage flashbacks, or events which are presented out of chronological order).

F10AF05AD54F4F74AEC5E090275A6B64.description: Explore and discuss grammatical features in a range of texts, e.g. verb forms, sentence types, use of different word classes.

85553E0D8F5E4CEB8D0D6DE8C473738F.description: Explore differences between written and spoken English by comparing narrative and dialogue.

0AB0EDA9473B432FB4CA24E900F06D1E.description: Explore, and understand, the use of active and passive verb forms.

D41A1097BA0648E7A136C605ADC2C6D5.description: Identify different word classes in texts and understand their purposes.

99E0E9D23E4D4C1B98B8EFB00758509A.description: Explore how different relative pronouns are used in texts to introduce additional detail.

EEF74CF7B3BF4C2593B938CBC90760EA.description: Begin to show awareness of the impact of a writer’s choices of sentence length and structure.

605C4DAAF00F495DAAE84740B6457AAD.description: Identify the main clause and other clauses (subordinate clauses) in a complex sentence.

5832AE2AD19047078E3743642DC528BC.description: Explore in texts, and understand, the uses of colons, semi-colons, ellipses, parenthetic commas, dashes and brackets.

64678A8C7ABF4A4796DBD6B876769A15.description: Begin to explain how figurative language creates imagery in texts and takes understanding beyond the literal.

BA993DABE8494D93A4D0336FE1D6E09A.description: Explore commonly used figurative expressions, e.g. as cool as a cucumber, crying crocodile tears.

1DAF867AD7BF432597DF3662881D838F.description: Comment on a writer's choice of language, demonstrating some awareness of the impact on the reader.

7669E56D5D8C4A35B0FC9ACBBA27F1D3.description: Identify and record interesting and significant words, and synonyms, from texts to inform own writing.

BF1477D2CD114305815BF102E12EC6D6.description: Explore word origins and derivations, including the use of words from other languages.

17DBF6BF78D3433686DAE28AE102ADCE.description: Deduce the meanings of unfamiliar phrases from their context, including phrases which are no longer common in modern times.
